citation.article-title: Tsukamurella gen. nov. harboring Corynebacterium paurometabolum and Rhodococcus aurantiacus.

p.s: Description of Tsukamurella paurometabolum (Steinhaus 1941) comb. nov.
Tsukamurella paurometabolum (pau.ro. me.ta´bo.lum. Gr.adj. pairs, little; Gr.adj. metabolus, changeable; M.L. neut.adj, paurometabolum little changeable)
The description below is based on data from references 1, 8, 13, 21, 25, and 26.
In addition to the characteristics of the genus the salient characteristics are given below.
Cells are straight to slightly curved rods (0.5 to 0.8 by 1.0 to 5 μm) and occur singly, in pairs, or in masses.
Coccobacillary forms occur.
Colonies are small (diameter, 0.5 to 2.0 mm) and convex, have entire edges (sometimes rhizoidal), are dryish but easily emulsified and are white to creamy to orange in color.
Metachromic granules may be formed.
Growth at 10 and 35°C, but not at 45°C.
Some strains do not grow at 37°C.
Does not survive heating at 60°C for 15 min.
Strictly aerobic.
Some strains produce acid from fructose, galactose, glucose, glycerol, inositol, mannitol, mannose, sorbitol, sucrose, and trehalose.
Acid is not produced from L-arabinose, L-rhamnose, or D-xylose.

Some strains grow on ethanol, fructose, galactose, glucose, inositol, mannitol, mannose, melizitose, sorbitol, sucrose, trehalose, xylose, n-butanol, isobutanol, 2,3-butylene glycol, propanol, propylene glycol, citrate, fumarate, malate, pyruvate, and succinate.
Does not grow on adonitol, arabinose, inulin, lactose, raffinose, or rhamnose.
Uses acetamide and nicatinamide as sole nitrogen sources but not benzamide.
Acetamide, glutamate, glucosamine, monoethanolamine, and serine are used as sole sources of carbon and nitrogen.
Degrades Tween 20, Tween 40, Tween 60, and Tween 80, but not adenine, casein, or elastin.
Some strains degrade xanthine and tyrosine.
β-Galactosidase and urease are produced, but arylsulfatase and alpha-esterase are not.
Pyrazinamidase positive.
Nitrite is utilized by some strains.
Resistant to ethambutol (5 μg/ml), 5-fluorouracil (20 μg/ml), mitomycin C (10 μg/ml), and picric acid (0.2%, wt/vol).
Susceptible to bleomycin (5 μg/ml).
The guanine-plus-cytosine content of DNA is 67 to 68 mol%.
Isolated from human sputum and the mycetomes and ovaries of bed bugs (Cimex lectularius).
The type strain is strain ATCC 8368 (= DSM 20162).
The type strain does not grow at 37°C, and colonies are creamy white in color.
Acid is not produced from inositol, mannitol, mannose, sorbitol, or trehalose.
Tyrosine and xanthine are not degraded.
